Yeah certainly from the Steelers I perspective what we would argue is that we're coming to the end of a three CARDINAL stage Bob Barrel PERSON Classic Bear Market so what that means is the first ORDINAL stage of a bear market is a dramatic drawdown you then get the reflective rebound and then you get the fundamental The mistake that's often made is that people look to signals of easing and say well that is the beginning of the bottom but the reality is the easing is a reflection of the problems that central bankers are To manage that takes time central banking policies work with a lag and as a result this is the end of the beginning not the beginning of the end and that means that easing is important but it's it's job it's role is to help the companies that are facing financial difficulty to manage that transition and and create the resolution that can form the bottom The fundamental bottom will be signaled by things like FDI ORG picking up not outflows continuing and as a result there's still more downside to markets. The other point you mentioned earlier was about credit spreads. However, we have an environment now where the rest of the developed world sometimes being called the Spence World ORG has taken on so much debt To sustain global growth that the distinction between these marks is not so stuck and as a result we think that there's another long-term value perspective here. Yes. Now you run one of the most important parts of JP Morgan ORG which is I say is the asset and wealth management business. What actually is wealth management and how is that different than asset management? Great question the two CARDINAL are often used interchangeably but they're they have distinctions asset management business is where we manage money and behalf of Institutions sovereign wealth funds pension funds we manage them in mutual funds we manage them in ETFs we manage them in single stocks single bonds Hedge funds private equity In the like and that is
Songs we manage them in ETFs we manage them in single stock single bonds Hedge funds, private equity, and the like, and that is the heart of the fiduciary business that we run here at J. P. Morgan PERSON . Wealth management is that plus, Standing someone's entire balance sheet. So, for the individuals where we manage money, we also help them with their mortgage. We help them with alone that they might need. We help them with their basic credit card and so wealth management is trying to help someone with their entire life both their assets and their liabilities, their planning, their The legacy that they want to leave for their families, the 529 CARDINAL plans they need to prepare to get their kids to go through college and it's a great, it's a great insight into people's, you know, entire journey. My name is Jeff Meish PERSON . I'm a journalist based in Los Angeles GPE . I wrote the story for Bloomberg Business Week ORG about Pepsi ORG 's number fever campaign. The Philippines GPE is a really interesting country. It's made up of thousands CARDINAL of islands. It's also a country that's very heavily influenced by America GPE . America GPE , culture is everywhere you look in the Philippines GPE . They're obsessed with Frank Sinatra PERSON music for example. They love all things America GPE and that extends to their their love for soft drinks Pepsi Cola Coca Cola ORG In the 1990 DATE 's it was everywhere. Pepsi ORG and Coca-Cola ORG were embroiled in what is now known as the Kolar Wars EVENT . It was a fierce battle Dominance. Eva was already a really popular promotion. It'd been rolled out in America GPE to great success. Pepsi ORG decided to roll it out internationally particularly in Asia LOC they thought it was the answer to their problems they thought it could finally help them beat their biggest competitor. Hey Hey Newspaper Millionaire. A one 1 million QUANTITY pesos or $68 thousand MONEY doesn't sound like a lot now but in 1992 DATE that was a phenomenal amount of money You've gotta remember that in the Philippines GPE at the time the average monthly DATE income was about $100 MONEY so Imaginations Number fever caught fire in the Philippines GPE Kids were saving up their pocket money to buy a bottle of Pepsi ORG Was squirreling away all of the bottle caps in bags you would walk down the street and people were going through trash trying to find discarded bottle caps It was a national phenomenon. Perhaps he posted that half CARDINAL the population of the Philippines GPE was playing it. Number five CARDINAL are boosted Pepsi ORG sales every month DATE from 10 1 million dollars MONEY to 14 1 million dollars MONEY . It had a huge impact on Pepsi ORG 's bottom line. Number fever quickly became number hysteria Aids were being jailed for stealing there employers winning bottle caps there was even Murders over overwinning bottle caps people were fighting in the streets Over There was signs that they were going to be problems with number fever very early. Pepsi ORG had rolled out the competition in Chile GPE Garbled facts had caused some kind of problem with the winning number. Causing riots That there could be big problems ahead They didn't keep their eye on the ball. 1992 DATE perhaps he decided to extend the campaign in the Philippines GPE and they announced that the competition would go on for a few more weeks DATE . One night TIME . They announced the latest winning number. 349 CARDINAL . The problem was Earlier campaigns so there were literally hundreds of thousands CARDINAL of bottle caps with 349 CARDINAL just floating around the Philippines Hundreds of thousands FAC of people all across the Philippines GPE thousands CARDINAL of islands We're finding winning bottle caps 9349 CARDINAL some people had 10 CARDINAL lucky 349 CARDINAL bottle caps People dancing in the street celebrating Thought their problems were over. They were millionaires. Still not certain exactly how many winners there were of lucky 349 CARDINAL bottle caps but we know that Pepsi ORG printed over 600 1000 QUANTITY of them.
Certain exactly how many winners there were of lucky 349 CARDINAL bottle caps but we know that Pepsi ORG printed over 600 1000 QUANTITY of them. Pepsi ORG realized very early that there was a problem Hundreds CARDINAL of people started arriving at their bottling plants with their lucky bottle caps They realise something was seriously wrong Pepsi ORG tried to solve the problem by offering a small token donation to anyone that brought a lucky bottle cap to their bottling plan But it wasn't enough. People didn't want just a handful of pesos. People wanted their one 1 million CARDINAL peso priors. Can you give us a sense of how many are out there in our solar system We know that there are a lot of asteroids in our solar system Most of them however are between Mars LOC and Jupiter LOC and what we call the main asteroid belt. This is a region of space where most of the Australians NORP in the inner part of our solar system live and they stay there for many billions of years. There is another population though that kind of leaks inward and gets into the Somewhat PERSON close to the earth. And we call these near earth objects.
